net.realmproject.dcm.event

Interface DeviceEvent

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IDeviceEvent

    public interface DeviceEvent
extends java.io.Serializable
    A DeviceEvent repreents a message on the DCM event graph. It can any of the types defined by DeviceEventType, and optionally contains a Serializable payload.
    Author:
    NAS

      • getDeviceEventType

        DeviceEventType getDeviceEventType()
        Gets the type of this event
        Returns:
        the type of this event

      • setDeviceEventType

        void setDeviceEventType(DeviceEventType type)
        Sets the type of this event
        Parameters:
        type - the new type of this event

      • getPayload

        <S extends java.io.Serializable> S getPayload()
        Gets the current payload for this DeviceEvent.
        Type Parameters:
        S - the actual type of the payload. This method will attempt to cast the payload to match this type parameter.
        Returns:
        The current payload. May be null.

      • setPayload

        void setPayload(java.io.Serializable payload)
        Sets the payload for this DeviceEvent.
        Parameters:
        payload - The new payload. May be null.

      • getTimestamp

        long getTimestamp()
        Gets the time that this event was published (according to the computer which published it). The time is represented as a unix epoch time with millisecond precision as returned by System.currentTimeMillis(). By default, this timestamp is set to the time DeviceEvent was created
        Returns:
        date of publication

      • setTimestamp

        default void setTimestamp(java.util.Date timestamp)
        Sets the time that this event was published (according to the computer which published it).
        Parameters:
        timestamp - the new timestamp for this event

      • setTimestamp

        void setTimestamp(long timestamp)
        Sets the time that this event was published (according to the computer which published it). The time is represented as a unix epoch time with millisecond precision as returned by System.currentTimeMillis()
        Parameters:
        timestamp - the new timestamp for this event

      • getZone

        java.lang.String getZone()
        Gets the zone this event was published in
        Returns:
        zone of origin

      • setZone

        void setZone(java.lang.String zone)
        The zone property is an arbitrary string representing what part of a larger network of devices the event originated from, and is usually not set by the publishing device, but by a component like a DeviceEventBus
        Parameters:
        zone - the zone this event originates from

      • isPrivate

        boolean isPrivate()
        Private events are events which are not meant to be propagated beyond the zone they were emitted in. DeviceEventBus implementations should not broadcast private events from other zones.
        Returns:
        true if this event is private, false otherwise.

      • setPrivate

        void setPrivate(boolean privateEvent)
        Sets this event as private.
        Parameters:
        privateEvent - indicates if this event is private.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        This DeviceEvent

      • getTargetId

        java.lang.String getTargetId()
        Represents the id of the Device this event is intended for. Only messages intended as point-to-point will require this field
        Returns:
        the id of the target Device

      • setTargetId

        void setTargetId(java.lang.String target)
        Represents the id of the Device this event is intended for. Only messages intended as point-to-point will require this field
        Parameters:
        target - the new id of the target Device

      • getSourceId

        java.lang.String getSourceId()
        Represents the id of the Device which emitted this event. This field should be set for all messages.
        Returns:
        the id of the source Device

      • setSourceId

        void setSourceId(java.lang.String id)
        Represents the id of the Device which emitted this event. This field should be set for all messages.
        Parameters:
        id - the new id of the source Device

      • deepCopy

        DeviceEvent deepCopy()
        Performs a deep copy of this DeviceEvent including making a copy of the payload.
        Returns:
        The deep copy of this DeviceEvent

      • shallowCopy

        DeviceEvent shallowCopy()
        Performs a deep copy of this DeviceEvent without making a copy of the payload.
        Returns:
        The shallow copy of this DeviceEvent

      • getRoute

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getRoute()
        Retrieves the route this event has traveled
        Returns:
        the stack of nodes this event has traversed
